1. TERMS AND DEFINITIONS

1.1. Company – DOO LUX SUNRIOR, PIB: 03346994 (hereinafter referred to as the Company).

1.2. User – a person who gains access to applications, services, and information provided on the Website.

1.3. Website – the Company's website, located on the Internet at sunriocarrental.com, including subdomains ***.sunriocarrental.com, as well as any other websites of the Company containing a link to this Agreement.

1.4. Agreement – this Agreement between the User and the Company, establishing the rules for using the Website, including graphic images and audiovisual content, design elements and individualization tools, textual information and documentation, software and downloadable files, and any other works, objects, and materials of the Website, as well as the terms and conditions for the User to post information and materials in the corresponding open sections of the Website.

1.5. Automated processing of personal data – processing of personal data using computer tools.

1.6. Blocking personal data – temporary suspension of personal data processing (except in cases where processing is necessary to clarify personal data).

1.7. Personal data information system – a set of personal data contained in databases and information technologies and technical tools ensuring their processing.

1.8. Anonymization of personal data – actions that make it impossible to determine the ownership of personal data to a specific subject without using additional information.

1.9. Processing of personal data – any action (operation) or set of actions (operations) performed with or without automation tools with personal data, including collection, recording, systematization, accumulation, storage, clarification (update, modification), extraction, use, transfer (distribution, provision, access), anonymization, blocking, deletion, destruction of personal data.

1.10. Operator – a state or municipal authority, legal or physical person, independently or jointly with other persons organizing and (or) processing personal data, as well as determining the purposes of processing personal data, the composition of personal data to be processed, and actions (operations) performed with personal data.

1.11. Personal data – any information related directly or indirectly to an identified or identifiable natural person (subject of personal data).

1.12. Provision of personal data – actions aimed at disclosing personal data to a specific person or a specific group of persons.

1.13. Dissemination of personal data – actions aimed at disclosing personal data to an indefinite number of persons (transferring personal data) or providing access to personal data to an unlimited number of persons, including publicizing personal data in mass media, placing them in information and telecommunication networks, or providing access to personal data in any other way.

1.14. Transborder transfer of personal data – transferring personal data to the territory of a foreign state, to the authority of a foreign state, a foreign physical, or legal person.

1.15. Destruction of personal data – actions resulting in the impossibility of restoring the content of personal data in the personal data information system and (or) the destruction of personal data carriers.

2. GENERAL PROVISIONS

2.1. This document defines the policy of DOO LUX SUNRIOR, PIB: 03346994 regarding the processing of personal data and the implementation of data protection requirements (hereinafter referred to as the Policy) in accordance with the requirements of Federal Law No. 152-FZ "On Personal Data" dated 27.07.2006.

3. SUBJECTS OF PERSONAL DATA

3.1. The Company processes personal data of the following individuals:

  • Employees of the Company;
  • Subjects with whom civil law contracts are concluded;
  • Candidates for vacant positions in the Company;
  • Clients of the Company;
  • Registered users of the Company's website;
  • Representatives of legal entities;
  • Suppliers (individual entrepreneurs).

4. PRINCIPLES AND CONDITIONS FOR PERSONAL DATA PROCESSING

4.1. The Company considers the security of personal data as the protection of personal data from unlawful or accidental access, destruction, modification, blocking, copying, provision, dissemination of personal data, as well as from other unlawful actions regarding personal data, and takes necessary legal, organizational, and technical measures to protect personal data.

4.2. Processing and ensuring the security of personal data in the Company are carried out in accordance with the Constitution of the Russian Federation, Federal Law No. 152-FZ "On Personal Data," subordinate acts, and other federal laws of the Russian Federation.

4.3. Principles of personal data processing:

4.3.1. The processing of personal data in the Institution is carried out based on the following principles:

  • Legality and fairness.
  • Limitation of personal data processing to achieving specific, predetermined, and lawful purposes.
  • Prevention of personal data processing incompatible with the purposes of collecting personal data.
  • Prohibition of combining databases containing personal data that are processed for incompatible purposes.
  • Processing only personal data that meet the purposes of their processing.
  • Compliance of the content and scope of processed personal data with the declared purposes of processing.
  • Prevention of processing personal data excessive in relation to the declared purposes of their processing.
  • Ensuring the accuracy, sufficiency, and relevance of personal data to the purposes of their processing.
  • Destruction or anonymization of personal data upon achieving the purposes of their processing or in the event of loss of necessity to achieve these purposes, unless otherwise provided by federal law.

4.3.2. Conditions for the processing of personal data:

  • Personal data is processed with the consent of the subject of personal data to the processing of their personal data.
  • The processing of personal data is necessary to achieve the purposes provided by law, to perform and fulfill the functions, powers, and duties imposed on the operator by the legislation of the Russian Federation.
  • The processing of personal data is necessary for the execution of a contract to which the subject of personal data is a party, a beneficiary, or a guarantor, or for entering into a contract at the initiative of the subject of personal data or a contract under which the subject of personal data will be a beneficiary or guarantor.
  • The processing of personal data is necessary for the realization of the rights and legitimate interests of the Society or third parties, or for achieving socially significant purposes, provided that this does not violate the rights and freedoms of the subject of personal data.
  • Processing of personal data that is made available to an unlimited number of persons by the subject of personal data or at their request.
  • Processing of personal data that must be published or disclosed in accordance with federal law.

4.4. The Company has the right to entrust the processing of personal data of individuals to third parties under a contract concluded with these parties.

4.5. Persons entrusted with the processing of personal data on behalf of the Company are obligated to comply with the principles and rules for processing and protecting personal data as provided by Federal Law No. 152-FZ "On Personal Data". For each person, a list of actions (operations) with personal data to be performed by the legal entity processing personal data, the purposes of processing, the obligation of such persons to maintain confidentiality and ensure the security of personal data during their processing, as well as the requirements for protecting processed personal data, are defined.

4.6. In cases established by the legislation of the Russian Federation, the Company is entitled to transfer the personal data of individuals.

4.7. For information purposes, the Society may create publicly available sources of personal data of employees, including directories and address books. Publicly available sources of personal data, with the consent of the subject of personal data, may include their last name, first name, patronymic, date and place of birth, position, contact phone numbers, and email address. Information about the subject of personal data must be excluded from publicly available sources of personal data at any time at the request of the subject of personal data or by a court decision or other authorized government bodies.

4.8. The Society destroys or anonymizes personal data upon achieving the purposes of processing or in case of loss of necessity to achieve the purpose of processing.

5. RIGHTS OF THE SUBJECT OF PERSONAL DATA

5.1. A citizen whose personal data is processed by the Company has the right to:

5.1.1. Receive from the Company:

  • Confirmation of the fact of personal data processing by the Company.
  • The legal grounds and purposes of personal data processing.
  • Information about the methods of personal data processing used by the Company.
  • The name and location of the Company.
  • Information about persons who have access to personal data or to whom personal data may be disclosed under a contract with the Company or based on federal law.
  • A list of personal data being processed related to the citizen who submitted the request and the source of its receipt unless another procedure for providing such data is provided by federal law.
  • Information about the periods of processing personal data, including storage periods.
  • Information about the procedure for exercising the citizen's rights provided by Federal Law No. 152-FZ "On Personal Data".
  • Information about the ongoing or intended cross-border transfer of personal data.
  • The name and address of the person processing personal data on behalf of the Company.
  • Other information provided by Federal Law No. 152-FZ "On Personal Data" or other federal laws.

5.1.2. Request clarification of their personal data, blocking, or destruction in cases where personal data is incomplete, outdated, inaccurate, illegally obtained, or unnecessary for the stated purpose of processing.

5.1.3. Withdraw their consent to the processing of personal data.

5.1.4. Demand the elimination of unlawful actions by the Company in relation to their personal data.

5.1.5. Appeal actions or inaction of the Company to the Federal Service for Supervision in the Sphere of Communications, Information Technology, and Mass Communications (Roskomnadzor) or in court if the citizen believes that the Company is processing their personal data in violation of Federal Law No. 152-FZ "On Personal Data" or otherwise violates their rights and freedoms.

5.1.6. Protect their rights and legitimate interests, including compensation for damages and/or moral harm through legal action.

6. ENSURING THE SECURITY OF PERSONAL DATA

6.1. When processing personal data, the Company takes the necessary legal, organizational, and technical measures to protect personal data from unauthorized or accidental access, destruction, modification, blocking, copying, provision, distribution of personal data, as well as from other unlawful actions concerning personal data.

6.2. To prevent unauthorized access to personal data, the Company applies the following organizational and technical measures:

  • Appointment of officials responsible for organizing the processing and protection of personal data.
  • Limiting the number of persons who have access to personal data.
  • Familiarization of subjects with the requirements of federal legislation and regulatory documents of the Institution regarding the processing and protection of personal data.
  • Organizing the accounting, storage, and handling of information media.
  • Placing technical means of processing personal data within a secure territory.
  • Identifying threats to the security of personal data during their processing and developing threat models based on them.
  • Restricting user access to information resources and software/hardware for processing information.
  • Registering and accounting for user actions in personal data information systems.
  • Using antivirus tools and system recovery tools for personal data protection.
  • Applying, where necessary, firewall tools, intrusion detection systems, vulnerability analysis tools, and cryptographic protection tools.
  • Organizing access control to the Society's territory.

7. FINAL PROVISIONS

7.1. Other rights and obligations of the Institution as an operator of personal data are determined by the legislation of the Russian Federation in the field of personal data.
